name: pnp-list-formatting-disable-click-action
title: Disable default click action on a tile list view
shortDescription: The sample list of items in a tile view where default click action is disabled. When item is clicked it is selected only.
longDescription: The sample list of items in a tile view where default click action is disabled. When item is clicked it is selected only.

metadata.value: ms-bgColor-white, ms-fontColor-neutralPrimary, sp-card-borderHighlight, sp-card-container, sp-card-content, sp-card-defaultClickButton, sp-card-highlightedContent, sp-card-lastTextColumnContainer, sp-card-subContainer, sp-css-borderColor-neutralLight

references.name: Use view formatting to customize SharePoint
references.description: You can use view formatting to customize how items in SharePoint lists and libraries are displayed. To do this, you construct a JSON object that describes the elements that are displayed when an item is loaded in a view and any styles to be applied to those elements.
